events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their car colliding with another vehicle at an intersection during heavy rain.
Claim was reviewed and categorised as an Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle collision.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the investigation and settlement process for the auto accident claim.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
Customer was requested to provide photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and medical bills related to the accident.
Customer submitted all requested documents including vehicle damage photos and an official police report.
Investigation team began assessing the vehicle damage and verifying details from the police report and submitted documents.
Investigation was completed confirming the accident was caused by adverse weather and traffic conditions beyond customer control.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the vehicle repairs and medical expenses related to the accident.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, agreeing that it fairly covers damages and associated costs.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company following customer agreement to the settlement terms.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and issued to the customer's bank account successfully.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after payment disbursal and confirmation from the customer.
The completed claim documents and records were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
